subject: Re: looking for comparision of JUnitEE and Parasoft's JTest
msgSnippet: Not in this case.  A balanced review of both solutions needs to be presented, we are merging two seperate organizations under one umbrella and they have done
messageBody:
Not in this case. A balanced review of both solutions needs to be
presented, we are merging two seperate organizations under one
umbrella and they have done things differently. With which ever
solution is decided a migration project would need to be done by one
side or the other.


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...>
wrote:
> Fazle Khan wrote:
>
> > I personally would like to stick with JUnitEE, but I need
evidence of
> > why we should.
>
> Shouldn't this be the other way aronund? If you're successful with
> JUnitEE, then shouldn't they have to give you evidence that you
should
> switch to JTest?
> --
> J. B. Rainsberger,
> Diaspar Software Services
> http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
> Let's write software that people understand
